intro: Lens culinaris subsp. esculenta, commonly known as the lentil, is an annual legume belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its small, lens-shaped seeds that are rich in protein, fiber, and essential nutrients. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. Its seeds are harvested when dry and mature, often used in various cuisines worldwide. The plant thrives in temperate climates and is cultivated for both its nutritional value and agricultural significance.
